title: Boeing boss admits mistakes over 737 Max design ahead of Washington grilling
text:
Boeing chief executive Dennis Muilenburg will acknowledge today that the aircraft manufacturer made mistakes as he appears at a Congressional hearing on two 737 Max crashes that killed almost 350 people, according to written testimony.

"We have learned and are still learning from these accidents, Mr Chairman. We know we made mistakes and got some things wrong," he will tell the US Senate commerce committee.

The testimony added that Boeing had made improvements to the now-grounded 737 Max "that will ensure accidents like these never happen again".
